text:
*Can we get Call-To-Action as a Re-enrollment Trigger in Workflows?* 
Didn't see a reason why it's forbidden? Can anyone tell me what the reasons behind this are?
```Workflow tells me: The following enrollment conditions can't be used for re-enrollment. Marketing email activity; clicked the link to; CTA.```
Use case is that I want to detect if a button, link or CTA is click more than once in a mail. Currently, the workflow can only perform its action once.

I would like to build an application that appears to live within the HubSpot application.  i.e., add a menu item in HubSpot, say under Marketing -> MyApplication. When you click that menu item, it shows a page running my react application. Is that possible? Or do I have to build a standalone application that lives on my server?

If anyone has any experience with sending 2FA PIN over SMS and handling such implementations in HubSpot I would very much like to hear your thoughts/ideas over at the community in my question:
<https://community.HubSpot.com/t5/APIs-Integrations/Integrating-a-two-factor-authentication-cycle-by-sending-a-2FA/m-p/524792/highlight/true#M48619>
If you’re trying to customize the HS menu (as in the HubSpot app menu), then I’m afraid you’re out of luck
Thanks, that is what I needed to know.
